actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

official_title: A bill entitled the "Hazardous Wastes and Human Health Survey Act".
short_title: Hazardous Wastes and Human Health Survey Act of 1989

summary.text: Hazardous Wastes and Human Health Survey Act of 1989 - Requires the National Research Council of the National Academy of Sciences to study and report to the Congress on: (1) a review of Love Canal, New York, Stringfellow Acid Pits, California, Times Beach, Missouri, and other representative sites, including whether epidemiologic studies were begun at such sites and what information is necessary to make policy choices about human health effects at such sites; (2) the general problems in epidemiologic studies; and (3) a description of what has been learned through environmental epidemiology about the effects of hazardous waste and an evaluation of research needs and the need to develop Federal data bases, clearinghouses, and programs to ensure that accurate information in the field is collected, analyzed, and disseminated to the public. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: Hazardous Wastes and Human Health Survey Act of 1989
A bill entitled the "Hazardous Wastes and Human Health Survey Act".
